ALBAWABA - Earlier on Monday, the Israeli army released a statement claiming the killing of the deputy minister for economy in Gaza, Abdul Fattah Al-Zeriei, alongside his mother in an airstrike on Deir al Balah.
According to a military statement, an attack "eliminated Abdul Fattah Al-Zeriei," an "operative in the Manufacturing Department of Hamas' Military Wing, who also served as Hamas' minister for economy in the Gaza Strip".
Breaking | An Israeli airstrike kills Deputy Minister of Economy Abdel-Fattah Al-Zuraiki and his mother in their home in Deir al-Balah, central Gaza Strip.
In response, Israeli armed forces announced targeting Hamas positions inside the Gaza Strip.
Thousands were killed, and dozens of thousands of others were injured in the Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip.

title: 3 Hezbollah members injured in Israeli airstrike on Lebanon
message:
3 Hezbollah members injured in Israeli airstrike on LebanonBeirut: Three members of the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah were injured in an Israeli airstrike targeting a motorcycle in the village of Bayt Lif in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military and medical sources said.
On Sunday afternoon, Israeli drones and warplanes conducted 15 airstrikes across 10 villages and towns in the border area of southern Lebanon, and three towns and villages in the Jezzine area.
Hezbollah’s military wing, the Islamic Resistance, claimed on Sunday to have attacked Israeli sites, including Al-Manara, Birkat Risha, and Ramyah.
Tensions are high in Lebanon following Israel’s attack on Dahieh in Beirut’s southern suburbs, which resulted in the death of a senior Hezbollah military commander, Fouad Shokor, and seven civilians.
Hezbollah Secretary-General Hassan Nasrallah has threatened a definite and painful response to the Israeli raid at the appropriate time and place.
event_breakdown: Israel conducted 15 airstrikes across 10 villages and towns in the border area of southern Lebanon as well as three towns and villages in the Jezzine area on Sunday. Three Hezbollah members were injured in the Bayt Lif village. Hassan Nasrallah’s has threatened a definitive and painful response to the Israeli raid on Dahieh.

title: Houthis claim attack on cargo ship in Gulf of Aden - Newspaper
message:
DUBAI: Yemen’s Houthi rebels on Sunday claimed a strike on a cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden in the first such attack since Israel struck the rebel-controlled Hodeida port last month.
British maritime security agency UKMTO and maritime security firm Ambrey said the Liberian-flagged Groton was struck twice by missiles near the coast of Aden.
The Houthis have attacked at least 88 commercial ships, according to the Washington Institute fro Near East Policy.
In an attempt to halt the attacks, American and British forces have carried out strikes on Houthi positions in Yemen since January 12.
The US military occasionally unilaterally strikes missiles and drones which it says are preparing to launch.

title: Iran Says It Will Punish Israel But Wants to Avoid All - Out War
message:
Iran Says It Wants to Punish Israel But Avoid All-Out War(Bloomberg) -- Iran reiterated it wants to avoid all-out war with Israel, even as it threatened to retaliate for last week’s assassination of a leading Hamas figure in its capital.
The comments come as Group of Seven and regional officials rush to avert a wider conflict.
G-7 members have reached out to Iran to try to ensure its retaliation isn’t serious enough to spark a regional war, according to people familiar with the matter.
Israel is in a “multi-front war against Iran’s axis of evil,” Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday.
Iran and Israel exchanged fire in April when Tehran accused its arch enemy of striking a consulate building in Syria.
event_breakdown:
Iran- Israel conflict
Tensions have been mounting between Iran and Israel since last week, with a leading Hamas figure assassination in Tehran. Iran reiterated its desire for revenge, this while G-7 officials work to prevent a regional conflict that could sparks a all-out war.

title: US , allies prepare to defend Israel as Netanyahu says it already in  multi - front war
message:
Israel is already in a "multi-front war" with Iran and its proxies, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told a Cabinet meeting Sunday, as the United States and allies prepared to defend Israel from an expected counterstrike and prevent an even more destructive regional conflict.
In Israel, some prepared bomb shelters and recalled Iran's unprecedented direct military assault in April following a suspected Israeli strike that killed two Iranian generals.
Inside Gaza, the Health Ministry said at least 25 people were killed and 19 others injured when Israel struck two schools in Gaza City.
One hit a tent camp for thousands of displaced Palestinians in the courtyard of Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital, killing four people, including one woman, the Health Ministry said.
The Health Ministry also said an Israeli strike on Saturday at a school-turned-shelter in Gaza City killed at least 16 people.

No one was killed in the attack.

title: US and allies prepare to defend Israel
message:
TEL AVIV, Israel — Israel is already in a “multifront war” with Iran and its proxies, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told a Cabinet meeting Sunday, as the United States and allies prepared to defend Israel from an expected counterstrike and prevent an even more destructive regional conflict.
In Israel, some prepared bomb shelters and recalled Iran’s unprecedented direct military assault in April following a suspected Israeli strike that killed two Iranian generals.
One hit a tent camp for thousands of displaced Palestinians in the courtyard of Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital, killing four people, including one woman, the Health Ministry said.
AdvertisementThe Health Ministry also said an Israeli strike on Saturday at a school-turned-shelter in Gaza City killed at least 16 people.
The Lebanese state-run National News Agency said an Israeli strike targeted a house in Beit Lef, and the Lebanese Health Ministry said two people were critically wounded.

title: Missile attack by Yemen Houthi rebels hits container ship in first attack in 2 weeks
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A missile attack by Yemen’s Houthi rebels struck a Liberian-flagged container ship traveling through the Gulf of Aden, authorities said Sunday, the first assault by the group since Israeli airstrikes targeted them.
AdvertisementThe attack on Saturday happened some 225 kilometers (140 miles) southeast of Aden in a stretch of the Gulf of Aden that has seen numerous Houthi attacks previously.
The rebels have targeted more than 70 vessels with missiles and drones in a campaign that has killed four sailors.
Meanwhile Saturday, the U.S. military's Central Command said its forces destroyed a Houthi missile and launcher in Yemen.
Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack on Israel, which killed 1,200 people and saw 250 others taken hostage, sparked the war.

message:
Russia has condemned the killing of Ismail Haniyeh, leader of the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas, in Iran last week and called on all parties to refrain from steps that could tip the Middle East into a wider regional war.
Sergei Shoigu, the secretary of Russia's security council, was shown by Russia's Zvezda television station meeting Rear Admiral Ali Akbar Ahmadian, a senior Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) commander who serves as secretary of the Supreme National Security Council.
Shoigu, who was Russia's defence minister before being moved to the security council in May, will also meet President Masoud Pezeshkian, Zvezda said.
"In Tehran, the secretary of the Russian Security Council is scheduled to meet with the president, the secretary of the Supreme National Security Council and the head of the General Staff," according to Zvezda TV.

title: Lebanese grapple with fear and tough choices as regional war looms
message:
As the spectre of a major war looms over Lebanon, civilians are bracing for the worst-case scenario.
Beirut, Lebanon – On July 27, Loubna El-Amine was waiting to board a connecting flight from Romania to Lebanon’s capital Beirut, having travelled from her family’s home in the United Kingdom.
Fearing how Israel would respond, El-Amine, a Lebanese-American, discussed with her husband whether to board with their three children or not.
Shortly after they arrived in Beirut, Israel assassinated one of Hezbollah’s top commanders, Fuad Shukr, by launching a rocket into a residential building in Dahiyeh, a district in southern Beirut.
The shadow of a major war has compelled El-Amine and her husband to cut their trip short and book a flight to Turkey for August 10, while some commercial flights are still available.

title: Day 303 : 30+ Civilians Killed in School Massacres by Israeli Forces
message:
On Sunday, day 303 of the Israeli assault on the entire civilian population of 2.24 million Palestinians in the Gaza Strip, Israeli forces committed two more school massacres, bombing 2 schools filled with internally displaced refugees, killing at least 30 and injuring many more.
Thirty civilians were killed and others were injured on Sunday in an Israeli airstrike that targeted two schools housing displaced people in Al-Nasr neighborhood, west of Gaza City, and a group of civilians in Al-Zeitoun neighborhood, southeast of the city.
The number of displaced people inside the Gaza Strip since the beginning of the aggression on October 7 has reached about two million people.
A civilian was killed on Sunday evening in an Israeli airstrike on Gaza City.
Two Palestinians were killed on Sunday evening in Israeli shelling of Deir al-Balah, central Gaza Strip.
event_breakdown: Israeli forces bombed 2 schools in Al-Nasr neighborhood, west of Gaza City, killing 30 civilians and injuring many others. They also shelled Al-Zeitoun neighborhood, southeast of the city, killing 2 Palestinians.

title: Israeli strikes Gaza schools and hospital compound after talks fail
message:
An Israeli airstrike hit two schools in Gaza City on Sunday, killing at least 30 people, Palestinian officials said, while the Israeli military said it struck a Hamas military compound embedded in the schools.
An Israeli airstrike hit a tent camp inside a hospital in central Gaza earlier in the day.
Gaza health officials said at least 44 Palestinians were killed on Sunday, the day after a round of talks in Cairo ended without result.

title: 37 civilians killed in Somalia beach attack
message:
An ambulance carries the body of a woman killed in a blast at a beach in Mogadishu, Somalia, on Saturday.
FEISAL OMAR/REUTERSMOGADISHU, Somalia — At least 37 civilians were killed and 212 injured in an explosion at a popular beach restaurant in the Somali capital Mogadishu late on Friday, the health minister said, an attack the government blamed on militant Islamist group al-Shabaab.
Ali Haji told a news conference that 11 of those injured in the attack were in a critical condition.
In addition to the civilians killed at the beach restaurant, police spokesperson Abdifatah Aden said one soldier was killed during the assault.
One of the attackers blew himself up, while three others were killed by security forces.
event_breakdown:
Al-Shabaab, which wants to topple Somalia's central government, was pushed out of the capital five years ago. However, it has continued to carry-can attacks aimed at overthrowing the Western-backed administration.

At least 37 civilians were killed and 212 injured in the explosion, the health minister said. In addition to the civilians killed at the beach restaurant, police spokesperson said one of the attacker killed the soldier, and three of the attackers were killed by security forces.

title: Two Hezbollah Members Killed In Israeli Airstrike On SE Lebanon
message:
(MENAFN- Nam News Network) BEIRUT, Aug 5 (NNN-NNA) – Two members of the Lebanese armed group, Hezbollah, were killed yesterday afternoon, in an Israeli targeting Lebanon's south-eastern village of Houla, Lebanese military and medical sources said.
The Civil Defence teams worked to remove the rubble, while an ambulance transported the two bodies to a hospital in the city of Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, the sources said.
They added that, Israeli drones and warplanes carried out six raids last night on four villages and towns in southern Lebanon, and Israeli artillery shelled eight border towns and villages in southern Lebanon with 30 shells.
On Saturday, the Hezbollah Military Media published an infographic, summarising its military operations against the Israeli army since Oct 8, 2023, in which it said, more than 2,000 Israelis were killed or wounded, through 2,500 military operations it carried out in 300 days.
Hezbollah Secretary-General, Hassan Nasrallah has threatened a definite and painful response to the Israeli raid at the appropriate time and place.– NNN-NNA

title: Macron , Jordan king urge avoiding ME escalation  at all cost - World
message:
PARIS: France’s Emmanuel Macron and Jordan’s King Abdullah II on Sunday said a military escalation in the Middle East must be avoided “at all costs” during a telephone call, the French presidency said.
Fears that the almost 10-month-old Gaza war could become a regional conflict have spiked as Iran and its Lebanese ally Hezbollah have vowed to avenge deadly strikes on Beirut and Tehran blamed on Israel.
Macron and King Abdullah “expressed their utmost concern” and “underlined the need to avoid a regional military escalation at all costs”, according to the Elysee’s readout of their call.
“They called on all the parties to end the cycle of reprisals, exercise the utmost restraint and responsibility to guarantee the security of the populations.”Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh died in a strike on Tehran on Wednesday that Iran blamed on Israel, hours after the Israeli assassination of Hezbollah’s military chief Fuad Shukr in Beirut.

title: Middle East tensions : Those leaving Lebanon hold their families extra tight as they say goodbye
message:
Beirut, Lebanon CNN —When our plane finally took off from Beirut, it was nearly an hour late.
Before departing for the airport, we held each other extra tight, not sure when we would see each other again.
Moments later, the Israeli military carried out a “targeted strike” in southern Beirut, roughly 10 minutes’ drive away.

The CNN team in Beirut later confirmed reports that Israeli warplanes had broken the sound barrier in skies over Lebanon.

title: Masked Anti - Immigration Rioters Break Into united kingdom Hotel Housing Asylum Seekers , 10 Police Officers Injured
message:
Violent clashes erupted in Rotherham, northern England, as masked anti-immigration rioters broke into a hotel sheltering asylum seekers, amidst the UK's most severe riots in 13 years.
Sky News reported that at least 10 officers were injured, including one who was left unconscious.
A police helicopter patrolled overhead, while at least one injured officer was escorted away, highlighting the escalating tensions and chaos.

title: US , allies prepare to defend Israel as Netanyahu says it already in  multi - front war
message:
Israel is already in a "multi-front war" with Iran and its proxies, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told a Cabinet meeting Sunday, as the United States and allies prepared to defend Israel from an expected counterstrike and prevent an even more destructive regional conflict.
In Israel, some prepared bomb shelters and recalled Iran's unprecedented direct military assault in April following a suspected Israeli strike that killed two Iranian generals.
Inside Gaza, the Health Ministry said at least 25 people were killed and 19 others injured when Israel struck two schools in Gaza City.
One hit a tent camp for thousands of displaced Palestinians in the courtyard of Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital, killing four people, including one woman, the Health Ministry said.
The Health Ministry also said an Israeli strike on Saturday at a school-turned-shelter in Gaza City killed at least 16 people.

title: Report : Majority of Hamas battalions still intact , some have rebuilt
message:
Israel has managed to completely destroy only a small minority of Hamas's battalions in the Gaza Strip, claims a report by the American Enterprise Institute’s Critical Threats Project, the Institute for the Study of War and CNN .
According to the report, which is based on Israeli and Hamas military statements, footage from the ground, and interviews with experts and eyewitnesses, only three out of the 24 battalions were considered combat-ineffective.
The report added that 13 battalions have only been degraded, and are only able to conduct sporadic, and largely unsuccessful guerrilla-style attacks.
According to the report, the central Gaza battalions are the most intact.
The report also noted that nearly half (7 out of 16) of Hamas’s battalions in the northern and central Gaza Strip have managed to rebuild at least some of their capabilities despite Israel's offensive.
event_breakdown: Israel has managed to completely destroy only a small minority of Hamas's battalions in the Gaza Strip, claims a report by the American Enterprise Institute's Critical Threats Project, the Institute for the Study of War and CNN.

title: Russia investigates defence official over fraud at military theme park
message:
MOSCOW (Reuters) -Russian authorities have detained another senior defence ministry official in the latest of a string of corruption investigations, this time related to a military theme park, the state investigative committee said on Monday.
Major General Vladimir Shesterov was detained on suspicion of fraud, it said.
Also arrested was Vyacheslav Akhmedov, director of the war-themed Patriot Park near Moscow that is a popular visitor attraction.
On its website, it also features a photo gallery of "heroes of the special military operation" - Russia's official term for its war in Ukraine.
At least a dozen people have now been caught up in the biggest wave of corruption scandals to hit the Russian military and defence establishment for years.

title: New Chief Takes Helm at Border Patrol Laredo Sector – Tickle The Wire
message:
Chief Patrol Agent Jesse D. MuñozBy Steve NeavlingBorder Patrol’s Laredo Sector has a new leader.
Jesse D. Muñoz, who began his career with the agency in Laredo in August 2000, was named chief patrol agent for the sector, the agency announced.
During his 23-year career, Muñoz has held various leadership positions, including acting chief patrol agent and deputy chief patrol agent of the Laredo Sector, acting deputy chief patrol agent of the Rio Grande Valley and El Paso sectors, deputy chief patrol agent of the Special Operations Group, assistant chief of the Joint Operations Directorate, and patrol agent in charge of the National BORSTAR Unit.
Before joining the agency, Muñoz served for eight years in the U.S. Army as a combat medic and vocational nurse.
He deployed in Turkey and Iraq in 1991 as a combat medic with the Third Infantry Division.
event_breakdown: Chief Patrol Agent Jesse D. Muñoz is named to lead the Laredo Sector of U.S. Border Patrol. Muñoz began his 23-year career in Laredo in August 2000.

title: Minister makes emotional pilgrimage to Japan to honour POW father
message:
Rev Ian Gilmour, a retired Church of Scotland minister from Edinburgh, travelled to Hiroshima where Private David Gilmour was held in a work camp for more than three years.
He placed his father’s British Army field book on an altar surrounded by flowers and prayed for peace during his stay.
“It was important for me to take his army field book so that there was something owned by him going back to Japan.
“He spoke about his wartime experiences publicly only once after he was asked to give a talk at his home church, Chalmers Church in Glasgow.
“However, after he gave the talk at the church he ripped out several pages of the field book and never spoke about his experiences again.”
event_breakdown: Peace offering: Rev Ian Gilmour, a retired Church of Scotland minister from Edinburgh, has travelled to Hiroshima to place his father's British Army field book on an altar and pray for world peace. The book belonged to Private David Gilmour, who was held in the work camp for more than three years. Mr Gilmour placed the book surrounded by flowers on the altar during his visit. He said he felt it was important to return something of value to Japan, and that he had spoken about his wartime experiences only once, and had never spoken about them again.

(With inputs from agencies)Several US military personnel sustained injuries on Monday in a suspected rocket strike on an Iraqi military base, according to US defense officials.The strike occurs amidst escalating tensions throughout the Middle East, following the recent assassinations of a high-ranking Hezbollah commander in Lebanon and the top political leader of Hamas in Iran last week.The Ain al-Assad base , situated in western Iraq, has been the target of a recent spate of rocket attacks, this base is home to American troops and personnel from the US-led coalition fighting against the Islamic State jihadist group .The attack on al-Asad air base in Iraq was confirmed by Iraqi security officials, but no group has claimed responsibility.
US defense officials stated that the troops stationed at the base are currently evaluating the extent of the damage caused by the attack.
"There was a suspected rocket attack today against US and coalition forces" at the base, a US defense spokesperson said.
"Initial indications are that several US personnel were injured.
""Base personnel are conducting a post-attack damage assessment" and updates will be provided as more information becomes available, the spokesperson added.Iranian-backed militias in Iraq have recently renewed their assaults on US military bases in Iraq and Syria after a period of several months.The attacks resumed following a strike on a base in Jordan in late January, which resulted in the deaths of three US soldiers and triggered a series of retaliatory strikes by American forces.From October to January, a coalition known as the Islamic Resistance in Iraq had consistently claimed responsibility for attacks, stating that they were carried out in response to "Washington's support of Israel in its war against Hamas in Gaza" and with the goal of forcing American troops to withdraw from the region.
event_breakdown:
Several US military personnel sustained injuries on Monday in a suspected rocket strike on an Iraqi military base, according to US defense officials. The Ain al-Assad base , situated in western Iraq, has been the target of a recent spate of rocket attacks.
The attack comes amidst escalating tensions throughout the Middle East, following the recent assassinations of a high-ranking Hezbollah commander in Lebanon and the top political leader of Hamas in Iran last week.

title: US mounts pressure campaign aimed at limiting Iranian retaliation
message:
simon2579/Getty Images(WASHINGTON) — As the Middle East braces for potential escalation of hostilities, diplomats at the State Department are trying to rally allies and partners to pressure Tehran into containing the scope of its retaliation against Israel that U.S. officials now view as inevitable.
However, they added that the U.S. doesn’t have a clear picture of Iran’s plan and that an attack could happen outside that window, as well.
Fouad Shukr, a Hezbollah commander, and Ismail Haniyeh, a top Hamas political leader, were killed last week in separate incidents.
Israel took responsibility for the strike that killed Shukr but has not said if it was also behind the attack that killed Haniyeh in Tehran, which Iran has blamed on Israel.

title: U . S . forces destroy multiple Houthi weapons , vehicles in past 24 hours : CENTCOM
message:
The U.S. Central Command (CENTCOM) announced on Monday that American forces recently destroyed three uncrewed aerial systems (UAS) belonging to Houthis.
CENTCOM added that U.S. forces also destroyed three other weapons and vessels belonging to the Houthis within the past 24 hours.
"Separately, USCENTCOM forces successfully destroyed one Houthi uncrewed surface vessel (USV), one Houthi uncrewed aerial vehicle (UAV) and one Houthi anti-ship ballistic missile (ASBM) in the Red Sea," the press release continued.
CENTCOM said that the weapons "presented a clear and imminent threat to U.S. and coalition forces, and merchant vessels in the region."

title: Iran Likely The Culprit As Rocket Attack At Iraqi Military Base Injures Multiple US Personnel
message:
Several U.S. personnel were injured in a suspected rocket attack at a military base in Iraq, U.S. defense officials said Monday, in what has been a recent uptick in strikes on American forces by Iranian-backed militias.
The attack comes as tensions across the Middle East are spiking following the killings last week of a senior Hezbollah commander in Lebanon and Hamas’ top political leader in Iran, in suspected Israeli strikes.
The U.S. defense officials said troops at al-Asad air base were still assessing the injuries and damage, and it appeared that as many as seven military troops and civilians were injured.
Earlier Monday, Iraqi security officials confirmed the attack, but no group has claimed responsibility.
The American officials said the U.S. looked into reports of a possible second attack at the base but determined there had not been another one.

title: Large - scale military exercises across western US and eastern Pacific airspace to last until August 9
message:
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY, Calif. – Santa Barbara County residents may notice an increase in military aircraft in the local airspace from Aug. 5 to Aug. 9 as part of military exercises coordinated among western United States military installations.
"Bamboo Eagle provides a combat representative environment," explained Major General Christopher J. Niemi, commander of the U. S. Air Force Warfare Center.
"By honing our capabilities in dynamic and challenging environments, we strengthen our ability to deter aggression and safeguard our nation's interests."
According to the Warfare Center, integrating training in the eastern Pacific Ocean and associated airspace is intended to give personnel "combat representative training" related to a marine environment.
The exercise includes augmenting command and control efforts with the Royal Air Force and Royal Australian Air Force from multiple basing locations in the western United States detailed the U.S. Air Force Warfare Center.

title: Israeli strikes hit Gaza schools , hospital compound after talks fail
message:
By Nidal Al-Mughrabi ReutersAn Israeli airstrike hit two schools in Gaza City on Sunday, killing at least 30 people, Palestinian officials said, while the Israeli military said it struck a Hamas military compound embedded in the schools.
An Israeli airstrike hit a tent camp inside a hospital in central Gaza earlier in the day.
Separate Israeli strikes killed eight others inside their home in Jabalia camp in northern Gaza City and three inside a car.
In Israel, sirens went off in the area of Ashdod and the Israeli military said five rockets were launched from southern Gaza.
At least 39,550 Palestinians have been killed in the Israeli military campaign in Gaza, according to the Gaza Health Ministry, which does not distinguish between fighters and civilians.

title: Russian missile attack on Ukraine Kharkiv injures five , governor says
message:
KYIV (Reuters) -A Russian missile attack on the city of Kharkiv in northeastern Ukraine damaged a medical clinic and injured at least five people on Tuesday, the governor of the Kharkiv region said.
Oleh Syniehubov also said on the Telegram messaging app that the Russian forces had used Iskander ballistic missile in the morning attack, adding that it had damaged dozens of cars and residential buildings and some administrative buildings.
Local authorities said earlier that the Russian strike on the central part of Kharkiv city had caused a fire.
Russia has pummelled the city, which lies less than 30 kilometres (20 miles) from its border, since its full-scale invasion of Ukraine began in February 2022.
(Reporting by Anastasiia MalenkoEditing by Alex Richardson and Gareth Jones)

title: 5 killed , 4 injured in Israeli airstrikes on southern Lebanon - Xinhua
message:
BEIRUT, Aug. 6 (Xinhua) -- Five people were killed and four others injured on Tuesday in Israeli airstrikes on two Lebanese villages, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
The military sources, who spoke anonymously, said that an Israeli drone targeted a house in the southern village of Maifadoun with two air-to-ground missiles, killing five people and wounding three others.
A state of caution prevails in Lebanon following Israel's attack on Dahieh in Beirut's southern suburbs in late July, killing Hezbollah senior military commander Fouad Shokor and seven civilians.
Hezbollah Secretary-General Hassan Nasrallah threatened a definite and painful response to the Israeli raid at "the appropriate time and place."
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
5 killed, 4 injured in Israel airstrikes on Lebanon

The attack occurred shortly after Israeli strikes targeted two Hezbollah bases in the country's Bekaa Valley region.

title: US To Deploy More Warships , Fighter Jets To Middle East
message:
(MENAFN- Khaleej Times) Published: Sat 3 Aug 2024, 7:44 AMThe United States will bolster its military presence in the Middle East, deploying additional warships and fighter jets to protect US personnel and defend Israel amid soaring tensions in the region, the Pentagon said Friday.
The announcement comes after Iran and its regional allies vowed retaliation for the killings of a Hamas leader in Tehran and a Hezbollah commander in Beirut, fuelling fears of a broader Middle East conflict.
The aircraft carrier strike group led by the USS Abraham Lincoln will replace one helmed by the USS Theodore Roosevelt in the region, Singh said.
Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin has also ordered additional ballistic missile defence-capable cruisers and destroyers to the Middle East and areas under US European Command, as well as a new fighter squadron to the Middle East.
Hours later, Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was killed in the Iranian capital – an attack on which Israel has not yet commented.
event_breakdown: Middle East-The United States is bolstering its military presence in the Middle East, the Pentagon said Friday, following rising tensions after the killings of a top Hamas leader and a Hezbollah military commander.

title: Hezbollah member killed in Israeli airstrike in S . Lebanon | Central India Premier English Daily
message:
Beirut, Aug 6 (UNI) A member of the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah was killed, and another was wounded on Monday afternoon in an Israeli airstrike targeting a motorcycle in the village of Ebba in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military and official sources told Xinhua.
The military sources, who requested anonymity, said that an Israeli drone fired two air-to-ground missiles at the motorcycle, killing the driver Ali Jawad Badreddine and wounding his companion.
According to military sources, Israeli drones and warplanes conducted seven airstrikes on four villages and towns in southern Lebanon, while Israeli artillery fired 20 shells on four villages and towns in southern Lebanon.
Tensions are high in Lebanon following Israel’s attack on Dahieh in Beirut’s southern suburbs, which resulted in the death of a senior Hezbollah military commander, Fouad Shokor, and seven civilians.
In response, Israel fired heavy artillery into southeastern Lebanon.

title: IDF airstrike targets Hezbollah buildings in southern Lebanon ; four members killed
message:
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed conducting an airstrike in Maifadoun , southern Lebanon on Tuesday, targeting a building allegedly used by the militant group Hezbollah.
According to the IDF, the structure was associated with Hezbollah's so-called southern Front unit , the group's regional command in the area.Lebanese security sources , cited by AFP, reported that five Hezbollah members were killed in the strike.The IDF claims that the targeted building housed members of the terrorist organization's southern Front unit, who were actively involved in promoting anti-Israel propaganda.In a coordinated operation, the IDF also targeted another building in Khiam, which was similarly used by Hezbollah.
The airstrikes were carried out under the intelligence guidance of Shin Bet, Israel's internal security service, and the military.An IDF X post loosely translated read: "Fighter jets of the Air Force attacked a short time ago under the intelligence guidance of the Shin Bet and Amman, a military structure that was used by the southern Front unit of the terrorist organization Hezbollah, in the Nabatia area in southern Lebanon.
A number of terrorists operated in the building who promoted terrorist slogans against the State of Israel.
"The IDF has not disclosed further details, and Hezbollah has yet to officially respond to the incident.

title: Israeli forces kill at least eight Palestinians in West Bank clashes , medics say
message:
(Reuters) -Israeli forces killed at least four people in the volatile city of Jenin in the occupied West Bank, medics said on Tuesday, following a night of violence in which four others were killed in clashes near Tubas, close to the border with Jordan.
The Israeli military said it conducted two separate air strikes in the West Bank, hitting armed militants, but gave no details.
The Palestinian Red Crescent confirmed that four people were killed in the strikes against two vehicles in Jenin, one of the most explosive flashpoints in the West Bank.
Israeli forces have killed hundreds of Palestinians in the West Bank and East Jerusalem since the start of the war, many of them armed fighters but many also stone-throwing youths or uninvolved civilians.
The official Palestinian news agency WAFA said the clashes occurred after Israeli forces surrounded a house in Aqaba and clashed with a group of young men.

message:

title: US Forces Destroy Houthi Drones , Anti - Ship Ballistic Missile
message:
In an Aug. 5 update , United States Central Command (CENTCOM) said three Houthi UAS launched from areas around Yemen were destroyed over the Gulf of Aden.
A Houthi UAS in a Houthi-controlled area of Yemen, one uncrewed aerial vehicle (UAV), and an anti-ship ballistic missile (ASBM) in the Red Sea were also destroyed.
CENTCOM said all these weapons posed a serious threat to U.S. and allied forces, which in turn is threatening regional stability.
“These weapons presented a clear and imminent threat to U.S. and coalition forces, and merchant vessels in the region,” CENTCOM said.
U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin ordered additional ballistic missile defense-capable cruisers and destroyers to the U.S. European Command and Centcom regions on Aug.2.
event_breakdown:
United States Central Command (CENTCOM) said it is deploying additional ballistic missile defense-capable cruisers and destroyers to the European Command and Centcom regions on Aug. 2.
CENTCOM did not give a specific reason for the deployment, but it comes days after a series of drone and rocket attacks on U.S. assets in Iraq, including one that hit a military base housing U.S. personnel.
The deployment also follows a series of ballistic missile tests by Iran, which the U.S. and its allies have accused of supporting the Houthis in Yemen.

title: Romans Were Terrified By War Elephants At First But Eventually Found A Way To Defeat Them In Battle
message:
Roman were reportedly terrified the first time they faced war elephants on the battlefield.
So began the ancient Mediterranean world's (rather misguided) fascination with war elephants.
One Greek leader who equipped his army with war elephants was King Pyrrhus of Epirus, who eventually went to war with the then-emerging power of Rome – and reportedly introduced them to war elephants.
He had been successful against the Carthaginian forces in Spain , where Rome's enemy had used elephants (albeit in small numbers).
Elephants are a double-edged swordOverall, war elephants in the ancient Mediterranean world could be useful against infantry – and especially horses – that had not experienced them before.

A member of Somali security forces stands guard next to the wreckage of two al-Shabab vehicles that were destroyed during an operation in the outskirt of Mogadishu, Somalia Tuesday
Security forces in Somalia killed at least 15 extremists from the al-Shabab jihadi group in an attack on one of their camps in the outskirt of Mogadishu, officials said.
Colonel Ahmed Muse, a Somali military officer, told The Associated Press on Tuesday that the military operation took place in part of the Lower Shabelle region, about 30 miles southwest of Mogadishu.
Minister of Information Osman Abokor Dubbe told local radio that among those killed were officials and foreign fighters trained by al-Shabab. He did not say how many foreign fighters or al-Shabab officials were among the dead.

The young Palestinian man was killed by Israeli army bullets near a checkpoint west of Bethlehem.

Amid the ongoing Palestinian-Israeli conflict in the Gaza Strip, the West Bank has also been witnessing rising tensions between the Israeli army and Palestinians.

title: LA supervisors to re - establish rewards for leads to Carson , Compton cemetery vandals
message:
The Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors on Tuesday, Aug. 6, re-established a pair of $20,000 reward offers for information leading to the arrest and conviction of those responsible for vandalizing two cemeteries in Compton and Carson, stealing bronze plaques and memorial markers.
On Jan. 6, vandals targeted Woodlawn Celestial Gardens cemetery in Compton, “one of the oldest operating cemeteries in Los Angeles County,” dating back to the 1880s, according to a motion by Supervisor Holly Mitchell requesting the reward.
“The cemetery includes numerous prominent figures and many local military veterans going as far back as the Civil War and the Spanish-American War,” according to the motion.
“A prominent bronze statue of President Abraham Lincoln that was dedicated in 1934 was damaged in an attempt to remove a plaque from the facade of the statue,” according to Mitchell’s motion.
Anyone with information on the crimes was urged to call Lt. Vincent Ursini from the Sheriff’s Department at 562-946-7008 or Crime Stoppers at 800-222-8477.
location: The main location where the event takes place is Compton, Los Angeles County, California.
event_breakdown: 1: $20,000 reward offered for information leading to arrest and conviction of those responsible for vandalizing two cemeteries in Compton and Carson, stealing bronze plaques and memorial markers.

title: First Huey replacement helicopter delivered to US Air Force
message:
Boeing announced on Monday it has delivered the first production MH-139A Grey Wolf helicopter to the U.S. Air Force.
But the Air Force has since dramatically slashed its planned purchase of the helicopter, which is now leading to cost overrun problems.
The service also plans to keep some older Hueys at the Air Force District of Washington, Fairchild Air Force Base in Washington state, Kirtland Air Force Base in New Mexico and Duke Field in Florida.
He previously covered leadership and personnel issues at Air Force Times, and the Pentagon, special operations and air warfare at Military.com.
He has traveled to the Middle East to cover U.S. Air Force operations.
location: The correct answer is Kirtland Air Force Base in New Mexico.
event_breakdown:
First MH-139A Grey Wolf Helicopter Delivered to U.S. Air Force: The first production MH-139A Grey Wolf helicopter has been delivered to the U.S. Air Force. The helicopter, produced by Boeing, is a military variant of the commercial Bell 412EP helicopter. The Air Force will use the Grey Wolf to replace the UH-1N Huey in the nuclear missile security role.
Air Force Slashes Planned Purchase of MH-139A Grey Wolf Helicopter: Due to budget constraints and the increasing cost of the new helicopter, the U.S. Air Force has cut its planned purchase of the MH-139A Grey Wolf from 75 aircraft to just 50. The Grey Wolf, which is produced by Boeing, is a military variant of the commercial Bell 412EP helicopter. The Air Force will use the Grey Wolf to replace the UH-1N Huey in the nuclear missile security role.
U.S. Air Force to Keep Some Older Huey Helicopters: In order to save on costs and meet the mission needs of some units, the U.S. Air Force plans to keep some of its older UH-1N Huey helicopters in service. The Hueys will be kept in service at the Air Force District of Washington, Fairchild Air Force Base in Washington state, Kirtland Air Force Base in New Mexico, and Duke Field in Florida. These helicopters will be primarily used for training purposes and to support Air Force missions in those areas.

title: Jammu and Kashmir : Encounter underway in Udhampur district
message:
Jammu: An encounter is underway between the security forces and a group of terrorists in J&K’s Udhampur district on Tuesday, officials said.
Officials said that an encounter between the security forces and the terrorists began in the Basantgarh area of Udhampur.
In order to eradicate terrorism from the hilly districts of the Jammu division including Poonch, Rajouri, Doda, Kathua, Reasi and Udhampur districts, the army has deployed over 4,000 soldiers, including elite Para commandos and those trained in mountain warfare.
Two of these detained suspects have confessed to having accompanied the terrorists when they carried out ambush attacks in the Doda area.
The security forces are aggressively carrying out operations in these districts to target the terrorists, their over ground workers (OGWs), sympathisers, and harbourers.
event_breakdown: Encounter underway between the security forces and a group of terrorists in J&K's Udhampur district on Tuesday, officials said. The encounter began in the Basantgarh area of Udhampur.

title: Three arrested after homicide , attempted robbery in Nash County
message:
NASHVILLE, N.C. (WNCT) — Nash County Sheriff’s Office responded to a report of a subject that had been shot on Saturday morning.
Deputies arrived on scene where they located a male identified as Caleb Turner, that had suffered multiple gunshot wounds.
Three individuals identified as Elijah Battle, Yasun Powell and an unnamed juvenile attempted to rob Turner of his firearm.
During the attempted robbery is when the shots were fired.
If anyone has information, contact the Nash County Sheriff’s Office.

title: IDF vs . Hamas : CNN analysis , Benjamin Netanyahu strategy
message:
CNN’s analysis of how successful the IDF has been in dismantling Hamas’s 24 battalions is crucial.
CNN defines the 24 battalions as: three ineffective (two northern Gaza, one Rafah), eight effective – three northern Gaza, two central Gaza, one Khan Yunis, two Rafah), and 13 degraded (seven northern Gaza, two central Gaza, three Khan Yunis, one Rafah).
To set a baseline, the IDF declared northern Gaza under operational control in mid-January and central Gaza and Khan Yunis under operational control in early February.
The IDF then withdrew from northern Gaza in rounds starting in mid-January and had withdrawn from Khan Yunis by April 7.
Calling 50 Hamas forces with no experienced commander (most experienced commanders are now dead or hiding in tunnels cut off from their forces) just “degraded” misses the point.
